title: Car will not start, no crank
symptoms: Turn key or press start, nothing happens
Dash lights may be dim or off
possible_causes: Faulty ignition switch or starter relay
recommended_actions: Check interior lights and headlamps for brightness
Inspect battery terminals for corrosion and tightness
Try jump-starting with proper cables and safety
If still dead, starter or ignition circuit may need diagnosis

title: Car cranks but does not start
symptoms: Engine turns over but never fires
recommended_actions: Check fuel gauge and listen for fuel pump buzz when key is ON
If recently ran out of fuel, there may be air in system
Professional scan tool and diagnostic is usually required

title: Check Engine light on (steady)
possible_causes: Emission control issues (O2 sensor, EVAP leak)
recommended_actions: Have codes read at parts store or mechanic
Do not ignore for weeks; unresolved issues can damage catalytic converter

title: Check Engine light flashing
symptoms: Engine may shake or lose power
recommended_actions: Reduce speed and avoid hard acceleration
Drive carefully to nearest safe location or shop
Have vehicle scanned immediately; continued driving can cause expensive damage

title: Overheating engine
symptoms: Steam or coolant smell from hood
recommended_actions: Pull over safely and turn engine off
Do not open hot radiator cap
Call for roadside assistance if temperature does not drop
Driving while overheated can ruin the engine

title: Brake warning light on
recommended_actions: Safely stop and check that parking brake is fully released
Check brake fluid level; if very low, do not continue driving
Have brakes inspected immediately

title: ABS or Traction light on
recommended_actions: You still have normal braking but no anti-lock function
Drive cautiously and schedule diagnostic soon

title: Steering wheel vibration at highway speed
recommended_actions: Have wheels balanced and tires inspected
Check for uneven tire wear
If vibration continues, steering and suspension should be inspected

title: Car pulls to one side while driving
symptoms: Vehicle drifts left or right when steering wheel is straight
recommended_actions: Check and adjust tire pressures to recommended values
If pull remains, schedule alignment check
If one wheel very hot after driving, brake may be dragging

title: Strange knocking or pinging noise from engine
possible_causes: Low-octane fuel in engine requiring higher grade
recommended_actions: Use manufacturer-recommended fuel grade
Avoid heavy acceleration until checked
Persistent knock requires mechanic evaluation

title: Battery light on while driving
symptoms: Lights may dim, power steering may get heavy
recommended_actions: Turn off non-essential electrical loads
Drive to nearest safe stop; car may die soon
Have charging system tested immediately

title: Grinding noise when braking
symptoms: Metal-on-metal sound when pressing brake pedal
Vehicle still stops but noise is loud
recommended_actions: Do not ignore; braking performance is reduced
Drive slowly to repair shop if safe, or tow
Expect need for pads and rotor replacement

title: Soft or spongy brake pedal
recommended_actions: Do not drive in traffic with poor brakes
Check ground under car for fresh fluid
Have system inspected and bled by professional

title: Transmission slipping
symptoms: Engine revs but car accelerates slowly
recommended_actions: Check fluid level and color according to manual
If fluid smells burnt, seek transmission specialist
Avoid heavy towing or hard acceleration

title: Power steering very heavy
symptoms: Wheel hard to turn especially at low speeds
recommended_actions: Check fluid level; top up with correct type if low
Inspect for leaks under car
If noise and stiffness continue, pump or rack may need repair

title: Oil pressure warning light
recommended_actions: Safely pull over and shut engine off immediately
Check oil level and add if low
If light stays on, do NOT drive; tow vehicle to shop

title: Fuel smell around car
symptoms: Strong gasoline odor near rear or under hood
recommended_actions: Tighten gas cap until it clicks
If smell is strong or you see liquid fuel, do not drive
Have vehicle inspected quickly due to fire risk

title: Vehicle drifts or feels loose over bumps
possible_causes: Worn ball joints or tie rods
recommended_actions: Drive cautiously and avoid high speeds
Have suspension and steering inspected soon
Severe wear can lead to loss of control

title: Air conditioner in car not cooling
symptoms: Fan blows but air stays warm
May cool slightly while driving faster
recommended_actions: See if AC clutch on compressor engages when AC is ON
If clutch never engages, fuses, relays, and refrigerant level must be checked
DIY recharge kits can be risky; better to see AC specialist

title: Car makes clicking sound when turning (front)
symptoms: Repeated clicking from front wheels on sharp turns
possible_causes: Worn CV joint on front axle
recommended_actions: Inspect CV boots for tears and grease splatter
Plan axle or joint replacement; failure can cause loss of drive
